Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899 – 6024.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth stole items from their guardian during a home visit. The
staff at the facility found them and spoke to youth in a demeaning,
bullying manner. They spoke inappropriately regarding the youth
and the youth's sibling.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on January 9,
2025, and reported they had no additional information.
Director of Residential and Vice President of Treatment
Programs were interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. They
both described Youth A returning from a visit and possibly having
some items he stole from the foster home. They both were aware
staff talked to Youth A about the stolen items trying to find out
where Youth A got the items. They both denied being aware of
Youth A being bullied by staff or staff using demeaning language
toward Youth A when asking about the items.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A
described having a phone call with his aunt and Staff 2. Youth A
stated Supervisor was present but did not say anything. Youth A
reported Staff 2 was mean during the phone call and said anything
I [Youth A] told my aunt was a lie. Youth A stated he could not
recall the specific words Staff 2 said but she was “mean.” Youth A
described hearing Staff 2 be mean to Youth B. Youth A stated
Staff 2 is mean because the way she talks. Youth A reported he
could not recall specifically what Staff 2 said to Youth B.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B
2

denied Staff 2 ever being mean or saying anything mean to him.
Youth B stated he has not heard Staff 2 be mean or call any youth
a liar. Youth B reported some youths do not like Staff 2, but Youth
B is unsure why other youth do not like Staff 2. Youth B stated
Staff 2 sometimes “will rush you and not give you enough time or
it’s how she [Staff 2] words things, but it is not mean.” Youth B
denied feeling bullied by any staff.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Therapist reported Youth A has not expressed any concerns with
staff bullying him or talking to him in a demeaning way. Therapist
stated Youth A does not like it when staff hold him accountable or
talk to him in a firm or stern tone.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor described hearing Staff 2 talk with Youth A about the
items brought back from his home pass. Supervisor denied
hearing Staff 2, or any staff talk to Youth A in a demeaning,
bullying manner. Supervisor reported Staff 2 was on the phone
with Youth A’s aunt and stated, Youth A struggles with lying, like
his [Youth A’s] brother. Supervisor stated Staff 2 was talking with
the aunt to see if Youth A did get his ears pierced while on the
home pass and if the aunt was aware of the stolen items Youth A
brought back to the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
he was working the day Youth A and Staff 2 had the phone call
with Youth A’s aunt. Staff 1 stated Staff 2 was trying to find out
from Youth A’s aunt if Youth A was being honest about the items
brought back from the home visit. Staff 1 denied hearing Staff 2
say anything inappropriate or demeaning to Youth A. Staff 1
reported Staff 2 was not verbally attacking Youth A and did not
call him a liar. Staff 1 stated he has never heard Staff 2 speak
mean to any youth.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C
denied hearing staff talk to any youth in a demeaning or bullying
way. Youth C reported he did not have any concerns with how
staff treat the youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
15, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
3

being on speaker (phone call) with Youth A’s family member
asking if Youth A got his ears pierced during his home pass. Staff
2 stated the family member had no idea Youth A pieced his ears.
Staff 2 reported Supervisor was nearby but not part of the phone
call. Staff 2 stated she spoke with Youth A about not being honest
about piercing his ears and how his ears could get infected. Staff
2 denied bullying or demeaning Youth A. Staff 2 stated during the
phone call Staff 2 said, “someone is not being honest.” Staff 2
reported she was talking with the family member trying to figure
out the piercing and updating the family member on the items
Youth A brough back from the home pass. Staff 2 denied hearing
any staff member demean or bully Youth A or any youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Residential Services Policies and Procedures
Behavior Support and Management: Unacceptable
Discipline Practices includes verbal abuse of a youth by
staff.
• Staff 2’s personnel file. Staff 2 had two disciplinary action
forms not related to verbal abuse or bullying of youth. Staff
2 completed the required Aegis training on 06/14/24.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Youth A is the only youth
reporting staff were talking in a demeaning, bullying manner.
Youth B, and staff interviewed denied staff demeaning or bullying
Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth was slapped by a staff member within the last 24 hours.
Staff has been excessively rough with youth during restraints,
bouncing the youth's head off the ground.
Investigation There were two reports made by two different complainants.
One of the allegations was only of the youth being slapped by
4

a staff member. Complainant was interviewed via telephone
on January 9, 2025, and reported they had no additional
information.
Director of Residential was interviewed face to face at the
facility on January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. Director of Residential reported Youth A was restrained
recently but there were no reports of the restraint being
excessively rough or of Youth A having his head bounced off the
ground. Director of Residential stated Staff 3 was escorted off the
property and placed on leave after the incident with Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A
reported Staff 3 slammed Youth A to the ground during a restraint
that occurred on 01/07/2025 in Youth A’s bedroom causing Youth
A to bounce his head off the ground. Youth A stated Supervisor
came into the bedroom after the restraint so did not see the slam.
Youth A reported there were no other youth or staff that saw the
restraint. Youth A stated he could not recall if he told anyone
about Staff 3 slamming him during the restraint. Youth A reported
this is the first time he was ever slammed in a restraint causing his
head to bounce off the ground.
Youth A described a few hours after Staff 3 restrained him Staff 3
hit Youth A in the face. Youth A stated Staff 3 punched Youth A
with a closed fist on the left side of Youth A’s face between the
eye and ear. Youth A denied seeing anyone from medical. Youth
A reported Staff 3 and Youth A were having an argument when
Staff 3 hit Youth A. Youth A stated Staff 3 walked out of Youth A’s
bedroom after hitting Youth A. Youth A reported there were not
any youth who saw Staff 3 hit him, but Supervisor was “right there
when it happened.” Youth A stated he has never seen Staff 3 hit
any other youth.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B
denied seeing any youth be restrained by staff being excessively
rough. Youth B reported he has never seen a youth bounce their
head off the ground during a restraint. Youth B denied seeing any
youth get slapped by a staff member. Youth B stated he feels
safe at the facility. Youth B denied having any concerns with staff
at the facility.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
5

Therapist reported she meets with Youth A at least one time per
week. Therapist reported Youth A talked to her today about Staff
3 hitting him.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor denied Staff 3 being excessively rough with Youth A
during restraints. Supervisor stated Staff 3 was struggling to hold
Youth A, so Supervisor entered Youth A’s bedroom to assistance
in the restraint. Supervisor denied Youth A was slammed to the
ground or hit his head during the restraint. Supervisor denied
having concerns with how Staff 3 performed the restraint.
Supervisor reported Youth A was in his room on the top bunk of
his bed after being escalated from arguing with a peer.
Supervisor described Staff 3 being in the doorway of Youth A’s
bedroom, leaning in talking with Youth A while Supervisor was
standing in the hallway. Supervisor reported he heard the noise of
a connection, like a slap, come from Youth A's bedroom.
Supervisor stated as soon as he heard the noise, Staff 3 moved
from the doorway, bent down to pick up his [Staff 3] belongings
and walked out of the facility. Supervisor described going into
Youth A’s bedroom to check on Youth A, who was crying and
holding his face. Supervisor reported he asked Youth A what
happened, and Youth A did not respond. Supervisor stated he
went to the staff office to call Staff 3 as Staff 3 entered the office.
Supervisor reported Staff 3 said, “If what I did has any
repercussions, I am just going to hand in my keys now.”
Supervisor stated he asked Staff 3 what happened, and Staff 3
said, “I slapped the fuck out of him I’m not going to lie to you.”
Supervisor reported he escorted Staff 3 out of the facility and
contacted Supervisor 2 about the incident.
Supervisor denied seeing Staff 3 slap Youth A from where he was
standing in the hallway. Supervisor stated he heard a connection,
like a slap sound. Supervisor denied any youth expressing
concerns regarding Staff 3. Supervisor reported this incident
happened a couple of hours after Staff 3 had restrained Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 denied
ever seeing Staff 3 restrain Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A
never talked about being restrained excessively rough by Staff 3
or having his head bounce off the ground during a restraint. Staff
1 stated Youth A told him Staff 3 slapped him.
6

Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Nurse reported
examining Youth A on 01/08/25. Nurse denied seeing any
bruising or swelling on Youth A’s face. Nurse stated Youth A
denied being in any pain. Nurse reported Youth A did not say
anything about being hurt in a restraint or being slapped by a staff
member.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C
describe Youth A “having an incident and being restrained in his
[Youth A’s] bedroom.” Youth C reported Staff 3 restrained Youth
A with the assistance of either Supervisor or Staff 4. Youth C
stated he did not see anything wrong with the restraint. Youth C
denied seeing Youth A’s head bounce off the ground during the
restraint. Youth C reported he saw the restraint because he was
in his room grabbing something. Youth C denied having any
concerns with how staff treat the youth. Youth C denied ever
seeing a staff hit or slap a youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
15, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 denied
ever seeing Staff 3 be excessively rough during a restraint or any
youth’s head bounce off the ground during a restraint with Staff 3.
Staff 2 stated she was working at a different house when Staff 3
slapped Youth A. Staff 2 reported she returned to the house and
Staff 3 was no longer working. Staff 2 stated Supervisor told her
what happened. Staff 2 reported Supervisor said he “was sick
about the situation.”
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
15, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3
described Youth A being escalated and struggling with his
behaviors on 01/07/24. Staff 3 reported Youth A was trying to kick
out a window in his bedroom and Staff 3 entered Youth A’s
bedroom to help deescalate the situation. Staff 3 stated Youth A
became physical and Staff 3 restrained Youth A with Supervisor’s
assistance. Staff 3 denied slamming Youth A to the ground or
being excessively rough. Staff 3 stated Youth A’s head never
bounced off the ground.
Staff 3 stated during med pass time, Youth A refused to take his
medication. Staff 3 reported he was frustrated by this and
dumped Youth A’s cup of water on the ground. Staff 3 reported
later the same day Youth A was on the top bunk in Youth A’s
7

bedroom turning the light on and off. Staff 3 described playing
“light tag” with Youth A, where Staff 3 would turn the light off when
Youth A would turn the light on. Staff 3 stated Supervisor was in
the hallway and told Youth A it was time to go to bed. Staff 3
described standing in the doorway leaning into Youth A’s bedroom
when playing light tag. Staff 3 stated Youth A had a pillowcase
and there was something in the pillowcase. Staff 3 reported Youth
A was upset and swung the pillowcase at Staff 3, so Staff 3 put up
his hand to “defend himself.” Staff 3 described Youth A as
“flicking the pillowcase” at him and the pillowcase wrapped around
Staff 3’s hand then hit Youth A in Youth A’s face. Staff 3 stated
after that happened, he walked out of the room. Staff 3 reported
Supervisor told him to “take five.”
Staff 3 described walking out of the facility and coming back to talk
with Supervisor a short period of time later. Staff 3 reported he
talked with Supervisor in the staff office and told Supervisor, “If
what I did in there will affect my job just take my keys now.” Staff
3 stated the pillowcase wrapped around his hand then hit Youth A
in the face. Staff 3 reported that is what occurred and that is what
he told Supervisor. Staff 3 denied telling Supervisor he “slapped
the fuck out of Youth A.” Staff 3 reported he was unsure why
Supervisor would have stated that information. Staff 3 denied
hitting Youth A. Staff 3 stated after the conversation with
Supervisor, Supervisor escorted him to Staff 3’s car. Staff 3
reported he left to go home and was called by Supervisor 2 to
return to the administration building to complete an incident report.
Staff 3 stated he has not worked since the incident.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via Teams on January 17, 2025,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor 2 described
arriving at the house and Staff 3 was sitting in Staff 3’s car.
Supervisor reported he entered the house, walked down the
hallway and asked Supervisor and Staff 4 to step away from
Youth A’s room. Supervisor 2 reported Youth A was crying and
stated, “[Staff 3] hit me.” Supervisor 2 denied seeing any injuries
or marks on Youth A. Supervisor 2 stated he went to the staff
office to talk with Supervisor. Supervisor 2 described Supervisor
being visibly upset and said, “[Staff 3] just told me he slapped the
fuck out of [Youth A]. Why would someone do that?”
Supervisor 2 reported Staff 3 told him Youth A was trying to hit
Staff 3 with an object and Staff 3 was trying to block Youth A.
Supervisor 2 stated Staff 3 told him [Supervisor 2] he was not sure
if he hit Youth A but did not think he did. Supervisor 2 stated he
told Staff 3 to finish writing the incident report then to go to Human
8

Resources to finish the conversation about what happened with
Youth A. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 3’s story changed some and
Staff 3 kept “backtracking” when he was describing what took
place in Youth A’s room.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
21, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker who joined via
Teams. Staff 4 stated Supervisor was in the hallway outside
Youth A’s room and Staff 3 was in Youth A’s room. Staff 4
described Staff 3 being upset and walking out of the facility. Staff
4 denied knowing why Staff 3 was upset. Staff 4 reported
Supervisor called for “eyes on” to go into Youth A’s room so Staff
4 walked down the hallway so Supervisor could enter Youth A’s
room. Staff 4 stated he did not know what happened, but Youth A
was crying and saying something to Supervisor. Staff 4 could not
understand what Youth A was saying. Staff 4 reported a short
time later Staff 3 came back into the facility and went into the
office to talk with Supervisor. Staff 4 denied seeing Staff 3 work at
the facility since this incident.
Staff 4 reported he has worked with Staff 3 in the past and denied
ever seeing Staff 3 hit a youth, be excessive during a restraint or
have concerns with how Staff 3 performed a restraint. Staff 4
stated there have not been any youth who have expressed any
concerns to him regarding Staff 3.
Video Review
Video footage of 01/07/25 was reviewed on 01/15/25 in
collaboration with DHHS Worker at the facility. There are no
cameras in the youths’ bedrooms at the facility. There is no sound
on the video. Video was reviewed of when nighttime medication
was provided to the youth. At no time was Staff 3 observed
pouring Youth A’s cup of water on the ground, as reported by Staff
3.
Video was reviewed showing the hallway outside of Youth A’s
bedroom. Staff 3 is seen standing in the doorway but more of
Staff 3’s body is in Youth A’s bedroom. Youth A’s bedroom light is
going on and off. Supervisor is in the hallway, outside of Youth
A’s bedroom on the phone. (Supervisor reported he was on the
phone dealing with an incident at another facility located on
campus.) Supervisor is seen entering Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 3
is seen walking out of Youth A’s bedroom, bending down to pick
up his items off the ground in the hallway, walking down the
hallway, then exiting the facility. At this point Supervisor is in
9

Youth A’s bedroom and Staff 4 walks down the hallway and
stands in Youth A’s doorway.
Several minutes later Staff 3 returns to the facility. Supervisor and
Staff 3 are observed alone in the staff office appearing to talk.
Supervisor is seen pacing, rubbing his temples and head, and
leaning over a chair during the conversation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Nursing notes dated 1/08/25 for Youth A. Nursing notes
document, “This nurse brought [Youth A] into the nursing
office to review any medical issues for a Hold review, and
youth reports not feeling well. “Nausea”. Medical follow up.
Youth was witnessed eating Dorito chips, no nausea. As well
lunch (Large Portion.) Denies Pain 0/10 Upper Extremities
range of motion equal bilaterally. Neck rotation normal range.
No cervical spine tenderness. Scapular rhythm movement
asymmetric. No notable swelling or bruising. Youth reports
understanding; if Pain does occur or he has any symptoms, to
return to nursing.”
• Staff 3’s personnel file. There was one disciplinary action
form dated 1/07/25 stating, “The allegation is significant
enough to warrant a suspension without pay, pending further
investigation.” Staff 3 completed the required Aegis training
on 08/09/24.
• Incident Report 204180239 for restraint of Youth A on
01/07/25 conducted by Staff 3. No injuries noted on report.
Report is consistent with Staff 3, Supervisor and Youth B’s
interviews.
• Statement of incident (Staff 3 slapping Youth A) completed by
Supervisor dated 01/08/24. Statement consistent with
Supervisor and Youth A’s interviews.
• Eagle Village Therapeutic Holds Policy. Policy documents,
“Eagle Village staff are trained in de-escalation techniques
which are designed to help the youth work through their
trauma or instances where they are triggered. De-escalation
techniques include but are not limited to: collaborative
problem solving, reminding youth of coping skills, separation
from the group or situation, use of sensory items, etc.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per Youth B and staff
interviews Staff 3 did not bounce Youth A’s head off the floor or
was excessively rough during the restraint.
The facility is found in noncompliance as per youth and staff
interviews Staff 3 was reported to have slapped Youth A.
10

Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code ACT NO. 116 of the Public Acts of 1973, As Amended
Title
Rule Code & 722.113b Smoking prohibited; “smoke” or “smoking”
Section defined.
Description
Sec. 3b. (1) An individual shall not smoke in a child caring
institution or child care center or on real property that is under the
control of a child caring institution or child care center and
upon which the child caring institution or child care center is
located, including other related buildings. The operator of a child
care center shall conspicuously post on the premises a notice
that specifies that smoking on the premises is prohibited.
(2) As used in this section and section 3c, “smoke” or “smoking”
means those terms as defined in section 12601 of the public
health code, 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.12601.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff was vaping in the facility.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A
described seeing Staff 1 vape in the staff office numerous times.
Youth A stated there was another youth who saw Staff 1 vaping in
the office, but that youth is no longer at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B
denied ever seeing any staff vape in the facility.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor denied seeing any staff vape in the facility or smelling
anything from a vape.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated he
recently has been vaping in his car, in the facility behind closed
doors and in the bathroom of the facility. Staff 1 denied seeing
any other staff vape in the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 had two disciplinary action
forms dated 01/09/24 and 08/24/12, neither incident was
related to smoking/vaping in the facility.
• Act 368 of 1978 333.12601 Definitions
11

(r) "Smoking" or "smoke" means the burning of a lighted
cigar, cigarette, pipe, or any other matter or
substance that contains a tobacco product.
(t) "Tobacco product" means a product that contains
tobacco and is intended for human consumption,
including, but not limited to, cigarettes, noncigarette
smoking tobacco, or smokeless tobacco, as those
terms are defined in section 2 of the tobacco products
tax act, 1993 PA 327, MCL 205.422, and cigars.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per staff and youth
interviews Staff 1 was vaping inside the facility. Staff 1 admitted
to vaping inside the facility.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Compliance with child protection law; development of plan
Title required.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
Description assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A told Staff 1 he was slapped by Staff 3 and Staff 1 failed to
report the information.
Investigation Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
9, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
Youth A told Staff 1 he [Youth A] was slapped by Staff 3. Staff 1
stated “I took it as a grain of salt and didn’t tell anyone.” Staff 1
reported Youth A made the statement in a “joking way” so Staff 1
did not think it happened. Staff 1 stated Youth A disclosed this
information the day after the incident with Staff 3 occurred.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Reporting Neglect and Abuse Policy. Policy
states,” All reports of suspected child neglect or abuse
must be immediately reported to the On Call Supervisor
who will report to the On Call Administrator. Eagle Village
administration will work with the reporter to submit incidents
of suspected physical abuse, sexual abuse, or neglect of a
youth in placement.”
12

• Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 had two disciplinary action
forms dated 01/09/24 and 08/24/12, neither incident was
related to failing report suspected abuse or neglect.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per Staff 1’s interview he
failed to report Youth A being slapped by Staff 3.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
